name: pulse
description: Pulse is a self-hosted status dashboard that shows the uptime and current status of various services. It includes configurable checks, notifications, and a lightweight UI.
features: Service monitoring: Track uptime and availability of websites, APIs, and network services.
Status dashboard: Display current status of all monitored services in a clean, public-facing interface.
Configurable checks: Set up HTTP, TCP, ping, and custom checks with flexible intervals and timeouts.
Notification alerts: Receive notifications via email, Slack, or webhooks when services go down.
Incident history: View historical uptime data and incident timelines for all monitored services.
Response time tracking: Monitor and graph response times to identify performance degradation.
Multi-location checks: Verify service availability from multiple geographic locations.
Maintenance windows: Schedule maintenance periods to suppress alerts during planned downtime.
Public status page: Share service status with users through a customizable public page.
SSL certificate monitoring: Track SSL certificate expiration and receive alerts before renewal.
Lightweight design: Minimal resource usage suitable for monitoring dozens of services.
API access: Programmatically manage monitors and retrieve status data via REST API.
